trans-unit.source: Contains information about a low-level keyboard input event

target.mrk: Contains information about a low-level keyboard input event

trans-unit.source: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Specifies a virtual-key code. The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a virtual-key code.
The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254

target.mrk: Specifies a virtual-key code.
The code must be a value in the range 1 to 254

trans-unit.source: Specifies a hardware scan code for the key

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a hardware scan code for the key

target.mrk: Specifies a hardware scan code for the key

trans-unit.source: Specifies the extended-key flag, event-injected flag, context code, and transition-state flag. This member is specified as follows.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the extended-key flag, event-injected flag, context code, and transition-state flag.
This member is specified as follows.

target.mrk: Specifies the extended-key flag, event-injected flag, context code, and transition-state flag.
This member is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: An application can use the following values to test the keystroke flags:

seg-source.mrk: An application can use the following values to test the keystroke flags:

target.mrk: An application can use the following values to test the keystroke flags:

trans-unit.source: $LLKHF_EXTENDED - Test the extended-key flag

seg-source.mrk: $LLKHF_EXTENDED - Test the extended-key flag

target.mrk: $LLKHF_EXTENDED - Test the extended-key flag

trans-unit.source: $LLKHF_INJECTED - Test the event-injected flag

seg-source.mrk: $LLKHF_INJECTED - Test the event-injected flag

target.mrk: $LLKHF_INJECTED - Test the event-injected flag

trans-unit.source: $LLKHF_ALTDOWN - Test the context code

seg-source.mrk: $LLKHF_ALTDOWN - Test the context code

target.mrk: $LLKHF_ALTDOWN - Test the context code

trans-unit.source: $LLKHF_UP - Test the transition-state flag

seg-source.mrk: $LLKHF_UP - Test the transition-state flag

target.mrk: $LLKHF_UP - Test the transition-state flag

trans-unit.source: 0 - Specifies whether the key is an extended key, such as a function key or a key on the numeric keypad

seg-source.mrk: 0 - Specifies whether the key is an extended key, such as a function key or a key on the numeric keypad

target.mrk: 0 - Specifies whether the key is an extended key, such as a function key or a key on the numeric keypad

trans-unit.source: The value is 1 if the key is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0

seg-source.mrk: The value is 1 if the key is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0

target.mrk: The value is 1 if the key is an extended key; otherwise, it is 0

trans-unit.source: 1 to 3 - Reserved

seg-source.mrk: 1 to 3 - Reserved

target.mrk: 1 to 3 - Reserved

trans-unit.source: 4 - Specifies whether the event was injected. The value is 1 if the event was injected; otherwise, it is 0

seg-source.mrk: 4 - Specifies whether the event was injected.
The value is 1 if the event was injected; otherwise, it is 0

target.mrk: 4 - Specifies whether the event was injected.
The value is 1 if the event was injected; otherwise, it is 0

trans-unit.source: 5 - Specifies the context code. The value is 1 if the ALT key is pressed; otherwise, it is 0

seg-source.mrk: 5 - Specifies the context code.
The value is 1 if the ALT key is pressed; otherwise, it is 0

target.mrk: 5 - Specifies the context code.
The value is 1 if the ALT key is pressed; otherwise, it is 0

trans-unit.source: 6 - Reserved

seg-source.mrk: 6 - Reserved

target.mrk: 6 - Reserved

trans-unit.source: 7 - Specifies the transition state. The value is 0 if the key is pressed and 1 if it is being released

seg-source.mrk: 7 - Specifies the transition state.
The value is 0 if the key is pressed and 1 if it is being released

target.mrk: 7 - Specifies the transition state.
The value is 0 if the key is pressed and 1 if it is being released

trans-unit.source: Specifies the time stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the time stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message

target.mrk: Specifies the time stamp for this message, equivalent to what GetMessageTime would return for this message
